New Records: Youri Tielemans scored the third-fastest goal in European Championship history after just 73 seconds
Jan Vertonghen became the oldest player to appear for Belgium at the UEFA European Championships
For the first time in the history of the UEFA European Championship group stage, all four teams in a single group will be level on points going into the final round of matches
Key Match Events: Kevin De Bruyne scored a second goal to wrap up a win that leaves Group E more open than any group has ever been in European Championship history
Lukaku had a goal disallowed by the VAR for the most marginal of offsides
Dennis Man ran through on goal but hit his shot straight at Casteels
Pre-Game Insights: Manager Domenico Tedesco dreamed up his gameplan for what was a must-win game
The Belgium team was stacked with expensive attacking talent
Post-Match Reflections: The victory leaves Group E as open as it could possibly be
With De Bruyne on form like this, Belgium really should be favourites to beat Ukraine and seal their passage into the knockout stage

Jan Vertonghen became the third-oldest player to appear for Belgium at a major international tournament, aged 37 years and 59 days
